name: Custom Scrollbars in Firefox 63/64+
description:
Check out the original style at userstyles.org
Based on:
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-width
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-color
additional_info:
*On macOS, you need to set the General > Show scroll bars setting in System Preferences to "Always" for this property to have any effect. Also possible use: widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.style to show scroll like macOS (1)/GTX (2)/Android (3)/Windows 10 (4)/ Windows 11 (5) - value "4" may works same as this CSS on Windows 7 (if use grayish colorize). widget.non-native-theme.win11.scrollbar.force-overlay-style to enforce tiny style like Windows 11 (at true value).





For version 63 only - this feature is behind the:
  • layout.css.scrollbar-colors.enabled
  • layout.css.scrollbar-width.enabled
preference (needs to be set to true). To change preferences in Firefox, visit about:config. Firefox 64+ don't need change anything in about:config to works CSS (override non-native keys is very optional).
